Package com.company

Class Problem

java.lang.Object
com.company.Problem
public class Problem
extends java.lang.Object
Class which encapsulates the data of the problem and expresses the problem.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Problem()
    Constructor which initializes the sources and the destinations Vectors.

    Generates a random instance of a problem to be solved.

    Returns a reference to the cost matrix which contains the bidimensional representation of the cost of transport

    Returns a vector of Destination which represents all the destinations added to the problem.

    Returns the number of sources.

    • getDestinations

      public java.util.Vector<Destination> getDestinations()
      Returns a vector of Destination which represents all the destinations added to the problem.
      Returns:
      a vector of Destination

    • setDestinations

      public void setDestinations​(java.util.Vector<Destination> destinations)
      Sets the vector of Destination which represents all the destinations added to the problem.
      Parameters:
      destinations - a vector of Destination

    • getSources

      public java.util.Vector<Source> getSources()
      Returns a vector of Source which represents all the sources added to the problem.
      Returns:
      a vector of Source

    • setSources

      public void setSources​(java.util.Vector<Source> sources)
      Sets the vector of Source which represents all the sources added to the problem.
      Parameters:
      sources - a vector of Source.

    • getColumnNumber

      public int getColumnNumber()
      Returns the number of destinations. Used for manifesting the same representation from the lab2. The destinations represents the columns.
      Returns:
      int

    • getLineNumber

      public int getLineNumber()
      Returns the number of sources. Used for manifesting the same representation from the lab2. The sources represents the lines.
      Returns:
      int

    • getCost

      public int[][] getCost()
      Returns a reference to the cost matrix which contains the bidimensional representation of the cost of transport
      Returns:
      type int[][] representing a matrix of cost transport.

    • setCost

      public void setCost​(int[][] cost)
      Sets the cost matrix to a specified matrix offered as parameter
      Parameters:
      cost - the matrix to set to

    • addSource

      public void addSource​(Source source)
      Method to add a source to the sources Vector. Verifies that a source is not added twice. If that happens, prints on the screen an message explaining the problem and exits the programme with -1.
      Parameters:
      source - the source to be added to the source Vector.
      See Also:
      Source

    • addDestination

      public void addDestination​(Destination destination)
      Method to add a destination to the destinations Vector. Verifies that a destination is not added twice. If that happens, prints on the screen an message explaining the problem and exits the programme with -1.
      Parameters:
      destination - the destination to be added to the destinations Vector.
      See Also:
      Destination

    • initializeMatrix

      public void initializeMatrix​(int[][] matrix)
      Method to initialize the cost matrix of the problem
      Parameters:
      matrix - a reference to a bidimensional array which represents the cost matrix

    • initializeMatrixKeyboard

      public void initializeMatrixKeyboard() throws java.io.IOException
      Method to read from the keyboard the cost matrix of the problem
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If an input or output exception occurred

    • printProblem

      public void printProblem()
      Prints the text returned by the method toString which is a textual representation of the problem

    • generateRandomInstance

      public void generateRandomInstance​(int upperLimit)
      Generates a random instance of a problem to be solved. The number of sources, number of destination the type of sources (Warehouse, Factory) and cost of transport is random.
      Parameters:
      upperLimit - the upper limit for the cost of transport, number of sources, and number of destination

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides toString method from Object and offers a text specific for that Problem
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      String
